intro: Tuberaria praecox, commonly known as the early tuberous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers, which bloom in early spring, are usually blue or violet in color. Tuberaria praecox is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
